page.title: 14SOCIAL CONCERN
page.content: {A COUNCILLOR'S VIEW OF ABERDARE. County Cllr Fitzgerald thinks the main problems facing this area are poor housing,unemployment and a run down of services generally. Although there have been many environmental and recreational improvements such as the Sports Centre,Country Park and the clearing of waste tips,the area still lags behind other similar areas in the country.It was suggested to Welsh M.P.s that the valleys should be allowed to decline as people move away to find work.Cllr. Fitzgerald sees this as a serious threat to community spirit.This spirit was demonstrated during the recent year-long miners' strike.He believes that although this is a difficult period,Aberdare will still survive and retain its identity and not become a commuter belt for Cardiff.
